notes: CoderLibrary repository created as a new project intended to be a living library for coders
Project framed as fully automated by AI using a workflow later named vibe working
Vibe working coined as the broader sibling of vibe coding to describe intent-driven AI execution beyond code
Initial README.md summary drafted based on human-provided intent and tone guidance
README summary reviewed and iteratively refined through feedback and preference adjustments
README summary rewritten multiple times to adjust sentence length punctuation and flow
README summary approved as final project description
Issue #1 created titled Add a Universal Scratchpad for Quick Coding Experiments
Issue #2 created titled Start activity logging
Decision made to introduce explicit activity logging beyond commit history
CSV selected as the logging format for simplicity machine readability and append-only behavior
Decision made to organize logs by month under a dedicated log directory
Log directory created to store monthly activity logs
File log/2026-01.csv created as the first monthly activity log
Activity logging formally started by reconstructing historical entries from prior conversation
